{ "step_by_step_thinking": "Erythema multiforme is a skin condition characterized by the appearance of red, target-like lesions on the skin. Keratosis folticularis, also known as Darier's disease, is a genetic skin disorder characterized by small, hard bumps on the skin. Erythema migrans is a rash often seen in the early stage of Lyme disease, which is not a skin disease but a systemic infection caused by a tick bite. Psoriasis form lesion is a type of skin condition where cells build up rapidly on the skin surface.", "answer_choice": "C" }
